text: "Hijan Hirao" (), also spelt as "Hichan Hilao"Hijan Hirao Text Context and Translation Book Review By James Oinam (), is a Meitei poetry text (puya), about the cutting down of a tree and crafting it into a boat. The poetic verse of the text is sung at the end of the religious festival of Lai Haraoba. ==Related pages== * Konthoujam Nongarol ==Bibliography== * ==Sources== * * ==References== ==Other websites== * Book review Category:Puya Category:Meitei literature Category:Poetry books
title: Hijan Hirao
